title: Drawing, "Putto Frieze; Classical Altar", ca. 1820
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Two putti hold indistinct bunches on a ribbon; one putto supported by third putto. Outside, putti with musical instruments.  Horizontal lines. Bottom right, an altar shown at angle.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Putto Frieze; Classical Altar", ca. 1820.
ca. 1820. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1229.
